      • move

        public static void move(int x,
                        int y)
                 throws java.awt.AWTException,
                        java.lang.SecurityException
        Moves mouse pointer to given screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException - if the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control. This exception is always thrown when GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        java.lang.SecurityException - - if createRobot permission is not granted

      • press

        public static void press(int buttons)
                  throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                         java.awt.AWTException
        Presses one or more mouse buttons. The mouse buttons should be released using the mouseRelease method.
        Parameters:
        buttons - the Button mask; a combination of one or more of these flags:
        • InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK
        • InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK
        • InputEvent.BUTTON3_MASK
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the button mask is not a valid combination
        java.awt.AWTException - if the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control. This exception is always thrown when GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        java.lang.SecurityException - if createRobot permission is not granted
        See Also:
        release(int)

      • release

        public static void release(int buttons)
                    throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                           java.awt.AWTException
        Releases one or more mouse buttons.
        Parameters:
        buttons - the Button mask; a combination of one or more of these flags:
        • InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK
        • InputEvent.BUTTON2_MASK
        • InputEvent.BUTTON3_MASK
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the button mask is not a valid combination
        java.awt.AWTException - if the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control. This exception is always thrown when GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        java.lang.SecurityException - if createRobot permission is not granted
        See Also:
        press(int)

      • wheel

        public static void wheel(int wheelAmt)
                  throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                         java.awt.AWTException
        Rotates the scroll wheel on wheel-equipped mice.
        Parameters:
        wheelAmt - number of "notches" to move the mouse wheel Negative values indicate movement up/away from the user, positive values indicate movement down/towards the user.
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException - if the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control. This exception is always thrown when GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        java.lang.SecurityException - if createRobot permission is not granted
